DataElement.preferredName: Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia Best Disease Response Evaluation Status
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the acute lymphoblastic leukemia best disease response evaluation status.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia Best Disease Response Evaluation
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Leukemia with an acute onset, characterized by the presence of lymphoblasts in the bone marrow and the peripheral blood. It includes the acute B lymphoblastic leukemia and acute T lymphoblastic leukemia._Having the most positive qualities._The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression._Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A leukemia with an acute onset, characterized by the presence of lymphoblasts or Burkitt cells in the bone marrow and the peripheral blood.  It includes the precursor B lymphoblastic leukemia, precursor T lymphoblastic leukemia, and Burkitt's leukemia.

Concepts.definition: Leukemia with an acute onset, characterized by the presence of lymphoblasts in the bone marrow and the peripheral blood. It includes the acute B lymphoblastic leukemia and acute T lymphoblastic leukemia.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having the most positive qualities.:The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.:Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.

Concepts.definition: The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.
Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

DataElementConcept.origin: DCI CRF:  Duke Cancer Institute Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredName: Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia Disease Response Status
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Leukemia with an acute onset, characterized by the presence of lymphoblasts in the bone marrow and the peripheral blood. It includes the acute B lymphoblastic leukemia and acute T lymphoblastic leukemia._The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression._A condition or state at a particular time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Indicates that an assessment was not performed.

Concepts.definition: Indicates that an assessment was not performed.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.

Concepts.definition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.

PermissibleValues.value: Complete Remission with Incomplete Hematological Recovery (CRi)
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Complete Remission with Incomplete Hematological Recovery

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Complete Remission with Incomplete Hematological Recovery
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment with residual neutropenia (less than 1,000 per microliter), with or without complete platelet recovery.

Concepts.longName: Complete Remission with Incomplete Hematological Recovery
Concepts.definition: The disappearance of all signs of leukemia in response to treatment with residual neutropenia (less than 1,000 per microliter), with or without complete platelet recovery.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2023.2.2 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0002006. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding indicating that there is a decrease in the size and the extent of tissue involvement by a malignant tumor in a patient.

Concepts.definition: A finding indicating that there is a decrease in the size and the extent of tissue involvement by a malignant tumor in a patient.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

Concepts.definition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes:
2023.5.17 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0002435. ak 
2023.3.15 Per LS at COG Protocol defined progressive disease (should have been added as a VM Alt Name for PV 3284666). ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The return of signs and symptoms of cancer after a period of improvement.

Concepts.definition: The return of signs and symptoms of cancer after a period of improvement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cancer that is neither decreasing nor increasing in extent or severity.

Concepts.definition: A disease that is neither decreasing nor increasing in extent or severity.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Leukemia with an acute onset, characterized by the presence of lymphoblasts in the bone marrow and the peripheral blood. It includes the acute B lymphoblastic leukemia and acute T lymphoblastic leukemia.:The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may refer to eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.:A condition or state at a particular time.

Concepts.definition: Leukemia with an acute onset, characterized by the presence of lymphoblasts in the bone marrow and the peripheral blood. It includes the acute B lymphoblastic leukemia and acute T lymphoblastic leukemia.
The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.
A condition or state at a particular time.
